group_1.textLeft: …It seems the Mongolian Army is once again@committing atrocities across the country.

group_1.textRight: Aren't many of the soldiers also Heruka's@followers?

group_1.textLeft: If they disobey, their families will be executed…@With that threat, they're doing what they must.

group_1.textRight: …Why go so far…?

group_1.textLeft: It's quite simple.
Because Heruka has pushed the Mongols@to that extent.
[chara:833800:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Hm?!

group_1.textRight: I initially thought Mongolia was finally@taking us seriously, too.
...But apparently there are also other factors@involved.

group_1.textLeft: H-heruka…@Uh, I mean, Lama Heruka.

group_1.textRight: The title isn't particularly important to me.@Please, simply call me by my name.
Just like when I was in the nunnery.

group_1.textLeft: …Why are you here?

group_1.textRight: I've been searching for the nunnery's old@teachers for a long time.
I was afraid I wouldn't make it.@I'm glad I managed to catch you…

group_1.textLeft: Are you here to punish us?

group_1.textRight: Punish?
Because we fled alone from the nunnery@when the Mongols attacked…

group_1.textLeft: I understand if you've come to resent us.

group_1.textRight: Ah, I see…@So that's how things were reworked.
Rest assured, that's not what I've come for.
We have both been asked to carry heavy@burdens.
Lama…@You were the only one I could think of.

group_1.textLeft: To help with your burden…?

group_1.textRight: Yes… Perhaps it was for this reason@that I learned to speak Mongolian.
I want you to be my accomplice.
After all, you were responsible@for teaching me the language.
[chara:833800:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]A battle of wits against Mongolia?!

group_1.textLeft: Yes…that is the nunnery's answer.

group_1.textRight: Reconciliation is impossible, then?

group_1.textLeft: …The opposition has no such intent.
Make up your mind, Your Reverence! The time is@nigh for our decisive battle against Mongolia!
We have nothing to fear.@Heruka will surely help us.

group_1.textRight: But…

group_1.textLeft: What choice do we have?
How else are we to survive?

group_1.textRight: …Can we even win this?

group_1.textLeft: Heruka's miracle will see to our victory.@That is what I have come to believe.
I've had so many thoughts about it…but now@I just want to believe in Heruka.
Any reports from the nunnery…?

group_1.textRight: Yes. They're gathering troops now and marching@on us.

group_1.textLeft: They call themselves soldiers, but it seems they@are nothing but a hodgepodge of amateurs.
They're desperate.

group_1.textRight: It looks like the strikes on the nunnery@have taken their toll.

group_1.textLeft: …How many of our men have defected?

group_1.textRight: A number that cannot be ignored…@Despite the orders they received…

group_1.textLeft: I see…@They've been tangled up in this absurd folly.
We must strike the enemy down quickly@and end this war.

group_1.textCenter: General, wait…!@We have messengers from the nunnery…

group_1.textRight: Sorry 'bout this. Mind if we join in?

group_1.textLeft: Um…it's been a while.
You… I remember…

group_1.textRight: The street performers!
Ah, yes…@We're the ones from the traveling troupe.
Who are these girls, General?

group_1.textLeft: Magicians from the nunnery.@We held them hostage for a time.

group_1.textRight: Yes. Thank you for what you did back then.

group_1.textLeft: Well, then…what do you seek now?

group_1.textRight: The nunnery will be bringing people here@tomorrow.
They want us all to have a meeting…@before the final battle.

group_1.textLeft: A meeting…@Very well, I accept.

group_1.textRight: General, isn't this risky?

group_1.textLeft: I've been wanting to speak with Lama Heruka.
Still…I've never seen you before.@Is this another one of your companions?

group_1.textRight: Ah, yes...we were able to reunite after we left.

group_1.textLeft: I see. It's strange for me to say this,@but I'm relieved you're safe.

group_1.textRight: …You say that, so why are you still fighting?@Why would you act like this?
Even you know that this isn't right.

group_1.textLeft: …How naive.
At any rate, I accept this decisive battle,@but I'm changing the date and location.

group_1.textRight: Huh?

group_1.textLeft: Come to Mongolia…to our steppes.

group_1.textRight: *Gasp*

group_1.textLeft: I know you've surely been planning something,@but I have no obligation to go along with it.
The outcome shall be determined on our soil,@fair and square.
